info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 02 at 4:28AM MDT until April 03 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 224 AND 234... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 224 AND 234... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 224 and 234. * Winds...For today, west southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. For Monday, southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph across the San Luis Valley, and 45 mph across Kiowa County. * Relative Humidity...As low as 12 percent across the San Luis Valley, and 7 percent across Kiowa County. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
